20250205.description:
Calling all Python enthusiasts, from beginners to seasoned developers! Whether
you've just started your Python journey or you're working on advanced projects,
this Python Open Mic Night is your chance to shine and share with the
community.

Here’s how it works:
Each speaker gets 15 minutes to present.
The topic? Anything Python-related! It could be a project, idea, library, tool,
or even a story about your Python learning journey. (Don’t worry if it’s not
purely Python—it just needs to connect to Python in some way!) All experience
levels are welcome, from complete beginners to professionals.

Why attend?
Get inspired by what others are working on. Learn something new—whether it’s a
coding trick, a tool, or a new perspective. Connect with Glasgow’s vibrant
Python community. Want to present? You don’t need to be a professional speaker!
If you’ve got something to share, we’d love to hear it. Just let us know
beforehand so we can schedule your slot.

Not presenting?
No problem! Come along, enjoy the talks, and meet like-minded Pythonistas.

It’s a laid-back, fun environment for sharing, learning, and connecting. Don’t
miss out—see you there!

Got questions or want to reserve a speaker slot? Reach out to us in our
submission
form ([https://polls.glasgow.social/index.php/346426?lang=en](https://polls.glasgow.social/index.php/346426?lang=en))
or by email
at [organisers@pythonscotland.org](mailto:organisers@pythonscotland.org)

talks.title: From Dirty Nappies to Clean Data: Analysing Newborn Care with Python
talks.speaker: Juan Palomeque-Gonzalez
